Table of Contents

This site is a collection of links, facts, and opinions on the topic of building REST APIs. It is intended to be a pragmatic discussion guide and shared reference as we start new API services engagements and is by no means all-encompassing. It is updated as we learn things from research, as the industry evolves, and with each client interaction on the topic.

RESTful

The term "RESTful" is often used when referring to REST APIs, because the ideals put forth in Fielding's dissertation are often challenging to implement in practice. RESTful can refer to embracing the core philosophies of REST while making concessions to the reality of competing demands in Enterprise IT & software development.
 

Particularly tricky areas include:

  • PUT & PATCH verbs
  • HTTP Response codes beyond a small set (200, 404, ...)
  • HATEOAS
